DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Platelet Cancer Progression Result Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: this question asks if evidence of progression was seen by assessment of Platelet count.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Platelet Cancer Progression Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of a medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for platelets, irregular, disc-shaped fragments of large bone marrow cells called megakaryocytes in the blood that assists in blood clotting, as a sign of progression, worsening of a cancer over time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: platelet. An irregularly shaped disklike cytoplasmic fragment of a megakaryocyte that is shed in the marrow sinus and subsequently found in the peripheral blood where it functions in clotting. A platelet contains granules in the central part (granulomere) and, peripherally, clear protoplasm (hyalomere), but no definite nucleus; is about one-third to one-half the size of an erythrocyte; and contains no hemoglobin. (STED98):The worsening of a cancer over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: An irregular, disc-shaped element in the blood that assists in blood clotting. Platelets are not blood cells, they are fragments of large bone marrow cells called megakaryocytes.
A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COMMENT_280
ReferenceDocuments.description: Add instruction before Long CDE Name: If yes, indicate all evidence of progression from the following:   (refer to protocol criteria for guidelines on organ assessment)

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is platelet count rising progressively to greater than or equal to 75,000/µL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 02
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient's platelet count fall below 50,000/µL post infusion?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Disease Response Ind-3 (2018751v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1) - dbw
